title: Containerizing Python Web Apps Workshop
description: A workshop about containerizing Python apps (using Flask as an example), running the Docker containers locally, and deploying them to Azure Container Apps.

title: Python HTTP APIs Workshop
description: A workshop about making HTTP APIs in Python, with either Flask or FastAPI, running them locally, and then deploying them to Azure.

title: Using PostgreSQL inside VS Code Dev Containers & GitHub Codespaces
description: A livestream about using Dev Containers inside VS Code and Github Codespaces to develop Python apps.

title: Python Web Apps Workshop
description: A workshop about making web apps in Python (via http/Flask/Django) and hosting them on Azure

title: Turning a Regression Model into an HTTP API
description: A talk about building a regression model from StackOverflow developer survey data using scikit-learn, and then turning that into a FastAPI HTTP API and deploying the API to Azure.

title: Python Web Apps
description: A lecture about making web apps in Python (via http/Flask/Django) and hosting them on Azure

title: The benefits of HTML slides for programming classes
description: A lightning talk about why I prefer using HTML-based slides (Reveal.JS) when teaching programming classes.

title: Education for All
description: A talk for an education focused hackathon about how educational materials can be brought online in an accessible, scalable, and inclusive manner.

title: CS+Social Good: Education
description: A talk for BayCSC about how computer science can be used in education. Includes discussion and projects.

title: Khan Academy AP CSP
description: A short talk for AP CSP teachers and providers about updates to the Khan Academy AP CSP offering for 2020-2021.

title: Coding Everywhere
description: A talk for Berkeley CTE about the many ways I've used coding, across school, college, career, and side projects.

title: Cultivating Empathetic Joy
description: A workshop about Empathetic Joy and how to train it, based on the Buddhist Immeasurable.

title: JS Freakin' Everywhere
description: A talk on how Woebot is built on a full JS stack - for the backend, "CMS", NLP, and more.

title: Pamela Fox: Learner, Creator, Teacher
description: A talk presented to a room full of Melbourne middle school girls, about my life story and jobs in the tech industry.

title: Massive Online Learning Challenges
description: A panel about putting on a "MOLC" (like Hour of Code), measuring its impact, and avoiding pitfalls. I talked about Summer of Scripting, a Khan Academy MOLC.

title: Making Computing Fun Again
description: A panel talk about how Khan Academy shows students the passion, beauty, joy, and awe of computing.
cospeakers: Jeremy Keeshin, Josh Caldwell, Dan Garcia

title: Pamela Fox: My Story
description: A talk presented to a room full of Melbourne high school girls who were visiting Silicon Valley and learning about STEM.

title: Programming is awesome
description: A keynote to a bunch of high schoolers about why I think programming is awesome, and what they might get out of it.

title: Why I love programming (and teaching it)
description: A talk about how I got into programming, what I discovered I love about it, and what I love about teaching it at Khan Academy.

title: Innovación en Educación Secundaria
description: A spanish-language talk about Khan Academy and how online education can change the classroom.

title: Teaching Programming Online
description: A tech talk about how we teach programming on KA, going into the HTML5/JS that powers the frontend and Python that powers the backend.

title: Hack On!
description: Tips for students about to embark on a hackathon, from prototyping to committing to pitching.

title: Creating Interactive Learning Experiences at Khan Academy
description: A talk and live demo of the real-time editing environment we created for Khan Academy, including examples of the crazy stuff we have to do to make it work.

title: Look Ma, No Image Requests
description: A discussion of 5 ways that we reduced image requests on our landing page, and the aftermath 4 months later.

title: Lowering the Barrier to Learning Programming
description: A talk about why we need more K-12ers learning CS/programming, and the ways which we can all lower their barriers.

title: Technical Interviews Make Me Cry
description: An Ignite talk about how I broke down during a technical interview, and what I think we should change.

title: Khan Academy Programming
description: An overview for high school CS teachers of the Khan Academy computer programming community and culture.

title: Reading, Writing, Arithmetic... JavaScript?
description: A talk about what it might mean if everyone learnt JS as a kid-- and an investigation into how early that could be taught.

title: Making JS More Learnable
description: A discussion about what parts of JS are hard to learn and how we can make it easier to learn, like via better debugging tools and error messages.

title: Teach the World To Code
description: A talk about why we need more developers and the non-traditional ways that we are creating more developers.

title: Developer Experience
description: A talk about what developer experience is and how to make it not suck.

title: Teaching Programming Online
description: A deep dive on how we teach programming online at Khan Academy.

title: Engineering Culture
description: A look at the ingredients of a great engineering culture, like code reviews, testing, and onboarding.

title: JS UI Library Design
description: A talk about the best practices we discovered at Coursera for writing JS UI Libraries, like encapsulation, idempotence, configuration, and more.

title: HTML5 Feature Detection & Fallback
description: A talk about the shiny new HTML5 features available, and how we should decide when to use them and how to fallback.

title: When Bootstrap Attacks!
description: The story of upgrading our Bootstrap 1 to Bootstrap 2, and what I'd recommend to everyone to avoid the pain that we went through.

title: Feature Detection in the Real World
description: A talk about feature detection vs. user agent sniffing, and the cases when feature detection just doesn't work and sniffing is the only way. (Revised for I/O)

title: Online Learning Made Social
description: A joint talk with Google Hangouts PM Amit Fulay about how Hangouts can be used in online learning to make it more social, and what we've learnt at Coursera in our experiments.

title: Frontend Architectures
description: A comparison of 3 frontend architectures at Coursera- Web 1.0, JS widgets, and single page web apps.

title: Feature Detection in the Real World
description: A talk about feature detection vs. user agent sniffing, and the cases when feature detection just doesn't work and sniffing is the only way.

title: Storylines: Pamela Fox
description: The story of how I grow up and got to where I am today.

title: Backbone: 3 Ways
description: An introduction to Backbone and a walkthrough of the 3 ways that we use it at Coursera.

title: JS in the front, REST in the back
description: Behind the scenes of the JS-centric, API-oriented architecture of Coursera, and why I like it.

title: When Mobile Browsers Attack!
description: A tale of the bugs I discovered in mobile web browsers and the horrible hacks that I had to deploy.

title: Backbone: 3 Ways
description: An introduction to Backbone and a walkthrough of the 3 ways that we use it at Coursera.

title: Beyond the Job Title
description: A talk for the Stanford Society of Women Engineers about my job decisions from childhood to today.

title: Rewriting Django Admin
description: Why and how I re-wrote Django Admin with a different architecture.

title: Django Admin: Widgets & Widgetry
description: Why we used Django Admin at Coursera (at first) and the crazy widgets we had to write for it.

title: PhoneGap Pain Points
description: A rant about what I found hardest about working with PhoneGap and mobile web browsers generally.

title: PhoneGap: Why & How
description: An overview of the strategies for making mobile apps, and then a deep dive on my PhoneGap architecture and workflow. Translated into spanish (click button).

title: localStorage: Use It, Don't Abuse It
description: An overview of the ways to use localStorage with tips on ways to use it responsibly, to not slow down or break your site.

title: A Year of Hermit Hacking
description: An Ignite talk about my year of hermit hacking - what I tried and what I learnt.

title: The Developer Experience (Summit)
description: Introduces the term "developer experience", talks about why it's important, gives examples of what makes a great experience, including a few makeover stories.

title: Picking a Technology Stack
description: An overview of the different components that make up a web app and a mobile app and thoughts on how to pick what's in your stack.

title: Teach the World To Code
description: A talk about why we need more developers and the non-traditional ways that we are creating more developers.

title: Why & How I Use PhoneGap
description: Based on the "Mobile App Strategy" talk, it starts with an overview of the strategies for making mobile apps, and then does a deep dive on my PhoneGap architecture and workflow.

title: Mobile App Strategy
description: Starts with an overview of the strategies for making mobile apps, and then does a deep dive on my PhoneGap architecture and workflow.

title: Client-side Storage
description: Introduces the new HTML5 client-side storage technologies and does a deep dive on localStorage, with many examples of how it can be used.

title: Mobile App Options
description: Gives an overview of the different strategies for outputting mobile apps, from native to runtime to cross compiled to hybrid.

title: How I became a born again vegetable-tarian
description: An ignite talk about my newfound love for veggies, my favorites, and tips for accepting veggies into your life.

title: Client-side APIs
description: Gives a history of client-side APIs and an overview of different types of APIs with interactive examples.

title: The Developer Experience
description: Introduces the term "developer experience", talks about why it's important, and gives examples of what makes a great experience.

title: No, Really, I'm Shy
description: Explains that I'm actually quite a shy person, and introduces my hacks to workaround that shyness.

title: Writing Apps the Google-y Way
description: Covers App Engine and the datastore, with Python examples. Slides also available for Brisbane version.

title: The Wonders of the "Onesie"
description: Introduces the concept of the "onesie" - the head-to-toe footed pajama - and what makes it awesome.

title: Wave APIs: Now & Beyond
description: Discusses the current state of the Google Wave APIs, and how they could be improved in future Wave implementations.

title: Mashups as Art
description: Talks about making data mashups, covering types of data sources, tools for making the data useable, tools for visualizing data, and example mashups.

title: Google's Client-side Web APIs
description: Reviews the history of client-side Web API technology, then gives an overview of Google's offerings and what can be done with them. See also this blog post.

title: Google Data APIs & Docs List API
description: Talks about the history of RSS/ATOM, gives an overview of the Google data protocol, then goes deep into the Google Docs Data API.

title: Google APIs: A-Z
description: Gives an overview of the many APIs that Google offers, in terms of API types, API genres, and API monetization techniques. Slides also available for version in Melbourne, Brisbane, DC-GTUG, NCA-GTUG, and MI-GTUG.
location: YOW! Nights (Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane), and GTUG (DC, NCA, MI)

title: Wave Robots API: Behind the Scenes
description: Starts with a explanation of the Wave protocol basics, reviews the history of the robots API, and explains several API design decisions.

title: Google Wave API Design Principles
description: Gives suggestions for designing Wave extensions (gadgets and robots) for a better and more Wave-y user experience.

title: Google Wave Gadgets API & Examples
description: Explains how the Gadgets API works and shows examples.

title: Google Wave Robots API & Examples
description: Explains how the Robots API works and shows examples.

title: Google Wave: Product, Platform, Protocol
description: Zooms through different features of Google Wave, like the real-time typing, threaded comments, extension platform, and federation.

title: Google Wave: The Protocol
description: Shows some of the key concepts in the Wave protocol, operational transforms and the conversation model.

title: Google Wave Robots API: Java
description: Explains how the Wave Robots API works, with code snippets and examples in Java.

title: Google Wave Gadgets API & GWT
description: Explains how the Gadgets API works, with code snippets and examples using the Google Web Toolkit in Java.

title: Google Wave Intro
description: Gives a brief overview of Wave and presents a series of screenshots showing how it can be used.

title: Making More than Just a Map
description: Highlights what features turn simple map mashups into full web applications, like linkability, subscription, editability, import/export, and searchability.

title: Google Wave for Students
description: Presents a series of suggestions (as screenshots) for how students can use Wave for groupwork.

title: Google Wave: What's New?
description: Summarizes new features added to Wave since launch, across the product, platform, and protocol, like better scaling, more APIs, and enterprise use. Concludes with a series of example uses.

title: Lowering the Barriers to Communication
description: Takes a look at the different methods of communication out there, from traditional snail mail to more modern forms, and how each of them encourages or discourages participation.

title: Innovation @ Google
description: Gives an overview of how innovation happens at Google - from finding the ideas to making it possible for engineers to implement them.

title: Google Wave Conversation Model
description: Explains the Google Wave conversation model - waves, wavelets, and blips.

title: Google Wave APIs
description: Shows a brief overview of the various Google Wave APIs.

title: Google Wave Gadget APIs
description: Shows a brief overview of the Google Gadgets API.

title: Google Wave Robots API v2 & Third-party Integration
description: Explains how the Robots API works inside Wave, shows the new features of the Robots API v2, and showcases some real uses of the API.

title: Google Wave: Communication Evolved
description: Shows how Wave combines features from many different communication products into one.
location: SF Wave Meetup & Hacks/Hackers (San Francisco, CA)

title: Google Wave Robots API v2
description: Explains how the Robots API works inside Wave, and shows the new features of the Robots API v2.

title: I'm a Barbie Girl in a Barbie World
description: Introduces the ultra feminine Computer Engineer Barbie, and why it’s a damn good thing.

title: Get Creative with Google APIs
description: Showcases creative uses of various Google APIs, like Youtube, Maps, and Social.

title: Understanding & Extending Wave
description: Shows the underlying XML structure of wavelets and blips, and then explains the fundamental concepts behind gadgets and robots.
location: GTUG Melbourne  & LCA Wave Mini-Conf (Wellington, NZ)

title: Google Wave: Product, Protocol, Platform
description: Zooms through the three "P"s of Google Wave.

title: Google Wave 20/20: Product, Platfom, Protocol
description: Introduces the various aspects of Google Wave.

title: Making Wave-y Extensions
description: Zooms through a series of tips on making extensions wave-y, based on the extension design principles doc, including suggestions like showing user locations in a gadget and making robots respond to natural trigger.
location: DevFest Mexico & LCA Wave Mini-Conf (Wellington, NZ)

title: Collaborative Mapping with Google Wave
description: Introduces Google Wave and then presents ideas about how it can be used with mapping and geography.

title: Making Maps Mashups
description: Zooms through a breakdown of the Maps API, an overview of all the Google Geo APIs, and a look at the various ways of rendering data on a map.

title: Mashups & APIs
description: Gives an overview of mashups, Web APIs, and highlights a few Google Web APIs.

title: A World of Words
description: Introduces languages, etymology, and how words are intricately connected.

title: Google Products: Deep Dive on Google Maps
description: Discusses how products are born at Google, and goes into a deep dive into what makes a product like Google Maps challenging.

title: Web APIs & Google APIs
description: Gives an overview of Web APIs generally, then Google’s offerings, then specifically Google’s offerings in Sydney.

title: Google Maps APIs: Overview
description: Begins with a general discussion of Web APIs, goes into depth on how the Google Maps JS API works, reviews the various Google Geo APIs, and finishes with examples of different ways developers can render their data on a map.

title: What You Don't Know About Geo APIs Can't Hurt You
description: Reviews a grab bag of features added to the Google Geo APIs in the year before: Panoramio, Reverse Geocoding, 3d Maps, Driving Directions, and more.

title: Performance Tips for Maps API Mashups
description: Provides tips on reducing latency for your maps mashup, discussing topics like marker management, clustering, custom tiles, static maps, flash maps, encoded polys, light markers, latency oriented features of the JavaScript Maps API, and more.

title: Growing up Geek: My Dad, the Computer Scientist
description: Summarizes my life growing up with two geeky parents and explains how I got involved in web development and related areas.

title: Google App Engine (Java)
description: Introduces the basics of App Engine and the datastore (BigTable), and ends with a coding walkthrough of a Java App Engine App (The Best Website Ever).

title: Google App Engine
description: Gives a basic overview of Google App Engine and its components (datastore, APIs).

title: Tips for Improving Usability of Maps Mashups
description: Discusses the most common usability problems in Maps mashups, and various solutions for those problems. The problems range from "too many markers" to "not enough navigation controls".

title: Living in the Cloud: Hosting Data & Apps Using the Google Infrastructure
description: Provides an overview of two technologies - Google App Engine and the Google Data APIs - that aim to make web development and data portability easier.

title:
Google Spreadsheets 
APIs & Gadgets
description: Introduces the Google Data APIs, Google Spreadsheets API, JSON/JSONP, and Google Spreadsheets Gadgets.

title: Client Killed the Server Star
description: Explains how new technology like Gears, HTML5, and Google App Engine could be used to create websites where the caching, storage, and computing is done primarily in the browser/desktop and the server is used merely as a backup store.

title: Gears & Offline Apps
description: Introduces the Gears APIs (local server, datastore, workers) and includes two offline demos.

title: Flash, Flex, & The Maps API for Flash
description: Reviews the differences between Flash and Flex, the power of AS3, and discusses the reasons that developers might choose the Flash API over the JS API. Includes several demos of the Flash API.

title: Flex vs. HTML5 for RIAS
description: Compares Flex versus HTML 5 in terms of features that compose a typical RIA (rich internet application).

title: OpenSocial Intro
description: Introduces the OpenSocial platform and Gadget APIs.

title: Open Maps (Or Close Enough?)
description: Gives a look at the various open source/open data options for an open maps stack - OpenStreetMap, OpenLayers, etc - with a deeper dive on the Mapstraction library.

title: Socializing Apps
description: Discusses the different ways of adding a social layers to apps inside social networks.

title: Moving the Web Forward with HTML5
description: Introduces new features in HTML5, like video, canvas, and new form tags.

title: Google Maps APIs Overview
description: Starts with an introduction to the Google Maps JavaScript API, then discusses several newly added features such as the AJAX Common Loader, Reverse Geocoding, ClientLocation, Flash API, Static API, and more. Ends with a description of KML and geo sitemaps. Slides also available for Beijing version.

title: Maps API Tips & Tricks
description: Suggests various ideas for more seasoned developers of the Google Maps APIs, such as using web services for more data, using spreadsheets as a database, or hosting on AppEngine.

title: Using Maps + AJAX APIs in AS3/Flex
description: Reviews what the Maps API for Flash can do, and show how to easily integrate it with other libraries for parsing XML/GeoRSS/KML/JSON.   It also shows how to use it with the non-JS version of the Google AJAX libraries. Includes an introduction to AS3, Flex development, and Flex controls.

title: Static + Flash Maps
description: Introduces the Static Maps API and Maps API for Flash, and various reasons for using them -  like using the Flash API for faster vector graphics, or using the Static Maps API for reduced latency on webpages.

title: From Mashups to Mapplets
description: Introduces Google Mapplets in detail, explaining how they relate to the Google Gadgets API, how they work behind the scenes, and how to develop them.

title: Producing Custom Maps with the Google Maps API
description: Discusses the different ways of overlaying custom map data on top of the Maps API mashups, covering the spectrum from the easiest technique (ground overlays) to the more difficult but sophisticated techniques (data-driven clickable custom tile layers).

title: Maps Mashups UI + UX
description: Introduces ways to improve the usability of maps mashups, like with custom markers, indicative icons, better infowindows, and customized controls.
location: SV Web Builder Meetup (San Francisco, CA)

title: Open Source Maps API Library
description: Gives a brief run-down of the various open source extensions available in the utility library.
